item.description:
installation link points to wrong location in following scenario.

  • uploaded the version to ftp.
  • goto blog/wp-admin/
  • it will show you one link to start installation by install.php
  • it will redirect to blog/wp-admin/wp-admin/install.php

item.title: Ticket #761 (Add hook to conditionally disable comment notifications) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #761 (Add hook to conditionally disable comment notifications) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: E-mail notifications for posted comments are controlled by the 'comments_notify' setting. E-mail notifications for comments needing modification are controlled by the 'moderation_notify' setting. Each is an all or nothing setting, i.e. if 'on', ALL post authors will receive notifications when appropriate. AFAIK, there isn't a clean way for a plugin to insert itself into the notification process.

item.title: Ticket #760 (Admin Authors page should also indicate number of draft for each ...) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #760 (Admin Authors page should also indicate number of draft for each ...) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: The "Authors & Users" subpage under "Users" in the Admin section should also indicate the number of drafts each author has, especially since there is no real way of assessing who has how many drafts (the "Manage" page will of course list the titles of all drafts, and of course a click-through on each will reveal the authors, but summarizing the draft count on a per-author basis might be of value).

item.title: Ticket #759 (Cannot make NEW post as another author, despite input field to do so ...) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #759 (Cannot make NEW post as another author, despite input field to do so ...) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: The Advanced version of post.php presents appropriately leveled authors the option to make a new post as another author. However, the value for the field is never taken into consideration and the post is always assigned to the true author. (The "Post author" field is currently only taken into consideration when a post is being edited.)

item.title: Ticket #758 (Draft content gets filtered, possibly munging data [w/ patch]) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code

item.title: Ticket #758 (Draft content gets filtered, possibly munging data [w/ patch]) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: Drafts are not always completed posts (perhaps having been saved in mid-writing to avoid losing the post in an unexpected browser crash). Since both the excerpt and content text get filtered, this could lead to problems, such as the balanceTags filter tacking close tags to the end of the incomplete post. Who knows what other filters/plugins would do to partial posts saved as drafts.

item.title: Ticket #755 (Not Found error when >2 static pages) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
After some fiddling with permalinks & htaccess permissions, now everything works.

I'm a little bit puzzled and do not know if the problem was maybe with the cookies, but major puzzle why the 12st two pages worked and not the rest?

However, it looks that this ticket can be closed :-)

Sincerely, Gour

item.title: Ticket #756 (no blog page) updated
item.dc:creator: elliot

item.title: Ticket #756 (no blog page) created
item.dc:creator: elliot
item.description:
blog page empty, php error of PHP Fatal error: Cannot redeclare () (previously declared in ./wp-includes/wp-l10n.php:23) in .wp-includes/wp-l10n.php on line 31

from what I can tell, 23 and 31 are in the same function. the administration side seems to work fine. I have not found anything like this in the forums.

item.title: Ticket #752 (Adding Category name to Permalink leads to 404 errors) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #752 (Adding Category name to Permalink leads to 404 errors) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I was testing the following permalink structure in the latest nightly: /%category%/%postname%/ gave me 404 error.

tried adding post number to remove any duplicate post with same name situation. did not work. again 404 error. people on the forum reproduced the problem.
